projects.title: Influence of Compressive Stress on Magnetic Characteristics of Grain-Oriented Material under Non-Sinusoidal Excitation
projects.description:
• Analysed the impact of mechanical stress on the hysteresis characteristics of magnetic materials subjected to non-sinusoidal excitation which provides a deeper insight into the core loss behaviour in electrical machines.
• Computed the core losses (hysteresis, eddy and excess losses) under the effect of compressive stress for hysteresis curves with minor loops by implementing an analytical approach using the Lavers formula and the loss separation theory which can also be used in the post-processing stage of FEM analyses.
• Obtained sufficient accuracy to predict the core loss values at any stress level using the proposed method considering suitable stress-dependent functions for the loss coefficients.

contributors.headline: Masters Student, TU Delft | Chair, SSD, TU Delft | IIT, Bombay | CoE-CNDS, VJTI

projects.title: Investigation of Rotational Magnetization Under Non-Sinusoidal Excitation for Soft Magnetic Materials
projects.description:
• Studied the phenomenon of rotational magnetism occurring in rotating electrical machines and T-joints in transformers. 
• Tested the phenomenon on a rotational single sheet tester (RSST) and examined the loop characteristics and power loss curves for CRNO and CRGO laminations for varying phase angles in the two different flux directions.
• Evaluated the various shapes of loops, ranging from elliptical to circular, that develop as a result of a change in phase angles and occur concurrently at separate locations in an actual electrical machine.
• Carried out a qualitative investigation of the measured hysteresis loops, the corresponding losses, and the variation of rotational loss in x and y components for different phase shifts under non-sinusoidal excitation for rotational magnetization.
• Visualized various flux patterns on account of rotational magnetization which will help to accurately predict the performance of a machine during its predesign stage.

contributors.headline: Masters Student, TU Delft | Chair, SSD, TU Delft | IIT, Bombay | CoE-CNDS, VJTI

projects.title: Current-fed and Voltage-fed Finite Element (FE) analysis of losses in Transformer Tanks
projects.description:
• Studied the effect of losses in transformer tank sheaths caused due to internal primary winding voltage sources and external current sources like high current busbars.
• Reviewed and simulated the effect of losses on mild steel, aluminium and stainless steel materials using FE analysis. 
• Obtained curves that signify the change of losses, resistance and inductance values with varying thickness of the tank

contributors.headline: Masters Student, TU Delft | Chair, SSD, TU Delft | IIT, Bombay | CoE-CNDS, VJTI

projects.title: Deep Learning based image classification approach for detection of low frequency oscillations
projects.description: • Collected data from Kundur’s Two Area test system using hardware PMUs and classified oscillation and stable images using image embedding techniques like Gramian Angular Field. Further, the images were trained on standard deep learning models like ResNet, VGGNet, MobileNet and DenseNet.

contributors.headline: Masters Student, TU Delft | Chair, SSD, TU Delft | IIT, Bombay | CoE-CNDS, VJTI

projects.title: Real-Time Hardware-in-Loop (RT-HIL) simulation of a Wide Area Oscillation Damping and Control System
projects.description: • Implemented a Wide-Area Damping Controller (WADC) which is used in conjunction with an Excitation Control System, ABB UNITROL 1020, to damp oscillations which are present in a power system network.

contributors.headline: Masters Student, TU Delft | Chair, SSD, TU Delft | IIT, Bombay | CoE-CNDS, VJTI

projects.title: Real-time Energy-sorted Prony Analysis and Matrix Pencil Algorithms
projects.description:

VIZIMAX and SIEMENS SIPROTEC PMUs, Raspberry Pi, NVIDIA Jetson Nano, NVIDIA Jetson TX2.

contributors.headline: Masters Student, TU Delft | Chair, SSD, TU Delft | IIT, Bombay | CoE-CNDS, VJTI

projects.title: Simulation Study and Analysis of Potential Measures for the Mumbai Blackout of 12th October, 2020 for Maharashtra Electricity Regulatory Commission (MERC)
projects.description:
• Performed a post-event study utilising recorded SCADA and PMU data from actual sites, replicated the scenario using a simulation model, implemented several islanding detection algorithms, and established a suitable under-frequency relay setting for proper load shedding.
• Analysed the effect of extra load on one of the generators by optimising load shedding techniques and/or estimating an appropriate value for boosting embedded generation to compensate.
• Conducted coincident and non-coincidental peak demand simulations to assess the efficacy of the newly designed system under COVID-19 load-generation and regular non-COVID-19 operating conditions, respectively.
• Submitted a report to MERC and high level committee working, for which the work was appreciated and taken into consideration for implementing in the actual Mumbai power grid.

contributors.headline: Masters Student, TU Delft | Chair, SSD, TU Delft | IIT, Bombay | CoE-CNDS, VJTI

projects.title: Short-Term Solar and Wind Generation Forecasting for the Western Region of India
projects.description:
• Forecasted 15 minute sampling generation of 3 solar and 7 wind stations from Bhopal and Gujrat respectively using stacked long short term memory (LSTM) approach and actual SCADA collected at sites. 
• Obtained solar and wind generation forecasted values with an accuracy of 90-95 percent at all sites, allowing utilities and control centres to reduce the discrepancy between scheduled and real values, minimizing unscheduled interchange costs.

contributors.headline: Masters Student, TU Delft | Chair, SSD, TU Delft | IIT, Bombay | CoE-CNDS, VJTI

projects.title: Energy Consumption Forecasting using a Deep Learning Energy-Level Based Prediction
projects.description:
• Performed energy level prediction simply by using only a classification approach instead of regressing and then classifying.
• Developed classification forecasting model for 3, 5, and 7 levels of energy classification using CNN-1D and random forest approach using smart meter data collected from a commercial building.
• Obtained an accuracy of 92 percent for 3 levels of energy classification using both CNN-1D and random forest classifiers.

contributors.headline: Masters Student, TU Delft | Chair, SSD, TU Delft | IIT, Bombay | CoE-CNDS, VJTI

projects.title: Optimal Placement of Phasor Measurement Units (PMUs) using Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) for  Jharkhand Urja Sancharan Nigam Limited (JUSNL) state transmission network
projects.description: • A graph theory-based algorithm in conjunction with Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) was used to provide optimized PMU placements to ensure complete observability of an approximately 200 bus grid involving 400kV, 220kV, 132kV and 33kV voltage levels.

profile_positions.description: • Assisting Professors in content creation, updation and delivery of the course - Introduction to Electrical Power Engineering.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• Implementing the knowledge of Finite Element Method (FEM) on the modelling of magnetic field, thermal field and electrical circuit parameters in a power transformer for the improvement of the course EE4375 - Finite Element Modelling for Electrical Energy Applications.
• Using Julia programming language for developing of FEM models to estimate the iron and copper losses in power transformers and additionally to analyse the temperature of substation in which the transformer is housed.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Assistant

profile_positions.description: The Sterkstroomdispuut (SSD) is a chapter of the Electrotechnische Vereeniging (ETV). The SSD is the student association for electrical power engineering students of the Delft University of Technology. We organise excursions, lectures and social activities for our students.
profile_positions.title: Chairman

profile_positions.description:
• Project funded by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO).
• Worked on the design and realization of a high-power, high-frequency planar transformer suitable for aerospace applications.
• Investigated the design parameters of Dual Active Bridge (DAB) topology and winding architecture of the planar transformer.
• Analysed various winding architectures for building a planar geometry using analytical formulae and FEM simulations.
• Developed an indigenous, domestically manufactured, planar transformer for the required application.
• Researched the development of optimal design methods to control the parasitic capacitance and inductance in the device.
profile_positions.title: Project Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• Interned under the Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE) and the Indian Institute of Technology Bombay.
• Worked on two-dimensional rotational magnetization phenomena in conventional rolled non-oriented (CRNO) and conventional rolled grain oriented (CRGO) electrical steels used in three-phase rotating machines and transformers.
• Examined the losses in the transformer tanks using voltage-fed and current-fed Finite Element (FE) analysis.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

company.name: Centre of Excellence (CoE) in Complex & Nonlinear Dynamical Systems (CNDS)

profile_positions.company: Centre of Excellence (CoE) in Complex & Nonlinear Dynamical Systems (CNDS)
profile_positions.description:
• Engaged in Smart Grids and Wide Area Monitoring, Protection and Control (WAMPAC) domain. 
• Operated on Real-Time Hardware-in-Loop (RT-HIL) simulations using OPAL-RT, VIZIMAX, SIEMENS, Cisco systems, and many more.
• Performed post-event analysis of potential measures for the Mumbai Blackout of 12th October 2020.
• Self-initiated two projects on renewable energy forecasting and smart meter-based load forecasting.
• Produced 3 publications from all the projects worked in the lab during the total timespan.
profile_positions.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• Training completed in the maintenance and operations department at Parel Receiving Station (110/33/6.6 kV).
• Studied in detail about single line diagrams, equipment and the overall operations and maintenance of receiving stations. 
• Conducted a brief study of the structure, operation and maintenance of transformers, ICTs, circuit breakers, relays, SCADA systems, gas insulated switchgears (GIS), etc. 
• Conducted and studied various tests such as contact resistance and insulation resistance tests on circuit breakers, knee point measurement and high potential test on capacitor backs, and leakage current measurement test on lightning arrestors.
profile_positions.title: Summer Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: Served as a reviewer for the 2021 56th International Universities Power Engineering Conference (UPEC) held in Middlesbrough, United Kingdom.
